para.text: These controls describe the area that will have buildings, roads, or other structures built on it and thus will have its infiltration capacity reduced.

para.text: is the size of the area that will be have its infiltration reduced due to the construction of buildings, roads, or other structures. The water that formerly infiltrated at the locations of these structures will now be diverted to an infiltration pond or other structure. See

anchor.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: is the fraction of the area of development that will be covered with buildings, roads, or other structures and thus will no longer be capable of infiltrating rainfall. Runoff from the impervious area is routed to the infiltration basin. Impervious areas are only included if the runoff from them is routed to the infiltration basin. See

anchor.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: is the depth of precipitation that will be considered in the design of the infiltration pond. The design storm is typically set by a regulatory authority. See

In the example in the illustration below, the light blue area is the area that will be developed and the gray area represents the locations buildings or roads that will be built. The area of development in this case is 100m x 100m = 10,000 m
. The 10 houses each have areas of 225 m
and the road has an area of 300 m
. The green circle is the infiltration pond with an area of 20 m

. Because rain that falls directly on the infiltration pond will be part of the water infiltrated through the infiltration pond, the area of the infiltration pond should be included in the impervious area if the infiltration pond is inside the area of development. The black area is also impervious but the runoff from it is routed elsewhere and is not included. Thus the total impervious area is 225*10 + 300 + 20 = 2570 m

. The fraction impervious is 2570/10000 = 0.255. In this example, the design storm has a depth of 4 cm. This might mean a rainfall rate of 4 cm/hour over a duration of 1 hour or 2 cm/hour over a duration of 2 hours. The total volume of water to be infiltrated is 10,000 m
